segment.source: Introduction to the Application Virtualization Security Guide
segment.target: Introduction to the Application Virtualization Security Guide

segment.source: Introduction to the Application Virtualization Security Guide
segment.target: Introduction to the Application Virtualization Security Guide

segment.source: Introduction to the Application Virtualization Security Guide
segment.target: Introduction to the Application Virtualization Security Guide

segment.source: This Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) security guide provides instructions for administrators who are responsible for configuring the security features that were selected for the App-V deployment.
segment.target: This Microsoft Application Virtualization (App-V) security guide provides instructions for administrators who are responsible for configuring the security features that were selected for the App-V deployment.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: This documentation does not provide guidance for choosing the specific security options.
segment.target: This documentation does not provide guidance for choosing the specific security options.

segment.source: That information is provided in the App-V Security Best Practices white paper available at http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=127120.
segment.target: That information is provided in the App-V Security Best Practices white paper available at http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkId=127120.

segment.source: As an App-V administrator using this guide, you should be familiar with the following security-related technologies:
segment.target: As an App-V administrator using this guide, you should be familiar with the following security-related technologies:

segment.source: Active Directory Domain Services
segment.target: Active Directory Domain Services

segment.source: Public key infrastructure (PKI)
segment.target: Public key infrastructure (PKI)

segment.source: Internet Protocol Security (IPsec)
segment.target: Internet Protocol Security (IPsec)

segment.source: Group Policies
segment.target: Group Policies

segment.source: Internet Information Services (IIS)
segment.target: Internet Information Services (IIS)

segment.source: APP-V Infrastructure Components
segment.target: APP-V Infrastructure Components

segment.source: When planning an enhanced security App-V environment, you can consider several different infrastructure models.
segment.target: When planning an enhanced security App-V environment, you can consider several different infrastructure models.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: For more information about App-V infrastructure models, see the following documentation:
segment.target: For more information about App-V infrastructure models, see the following documentation:

segment.source: App-V Planning and Deployment Guide
segment.target: App-V Planning and Deployment Guide

segment.source: Infrastructure Planning and Design Guide Series
segment.target: Infrastructure Planning and Design Guide Series

segment.source: These models utilize some but possibly not all of the App-V components depicted in the following illustration.
segment.target: These models utilize some but possibly not all of the App-V components depicted in the following illustration.

segment.source: app-v branch office diagram
segment.target: app-v branch office diagram

segment.source: Application Virtualization (App-V) Management Server
segment.target: Application Virtualization (App-V) Management Server

segment.source: The App-V Management Server streams the package content and publishes the shortcuts and file-type associations to the App-V Client.
segment.target: The App-V Management Server streams the package content and publishes the shortcuts and file-type associations to the App-V Client.

segment.source: The App-V Management Server also supports active upgrade, license management, and a database that can be used for reporting.
segment.target: The App-V Management Server also supports active upgrade, license management, and a database that can be used for reporting.

segment.source: Application Virtualization (App-V) Streaming Server
segment.target: Application Virtualization (App-V) Streaming Server

segment.source: The App-V Streaming Server hosts the packages for streaming to App-V Clients in environments such as branch offices, where the bandwidth of the connection to the App-V Management Server is insufficient for streaming package content to clients.
segment.target: The App-V Streaming Server hosts the packages for streaming to App-V Clients in environments such as branch offices, where the bandwidth of the connection to the App-V Management Server is insufficient for streaming package content to clients.

segment.source: The Streaming Server contains only streaming functionality and does not provide you with the App-V Management Console or the App-V Management Web Service.
segment.target: The Streaming Server contains only streaming functionality and does not provide you with the App-V Management Console or the App-V Management Web Service.

segment.source: Application Virtualization (App-V) Data Store
segment.target: Application Virtualization (App-V) Data Store

segment.source: The App-V data store, in the SQL database, retains information related to the App-V infrastructure.
segment.target: The App-V data store, in the SQL database, retains information related to the App-V infrastructure.

segment.source: The information in the App-V data store includes all application records, application assignments, and which groups manage the Application Virtualization environment.
segment.target: The information in the App-V data store includes all application records, application assignments, and which groups manage the Application Virtualization environment.

segment.source: Application Virtualization (App-V) Management Service
segment.target: Application Virtualization (App-V) Management Service

segment.source: The App-V Management Service communicates read/write requests to the Application Virtualization data store.
segment.target: The App-V Management Service communicates read/write requests to the Application Virtualization data store.

segment.source: This component can be installed on the same computer as the App-V Management Server or on a separate computer with IIS installed.
segment.target: This component can be installed on the same computer as the App-V Management Server or on a separate computer with IIS installed.

segment.source: Application Virtualization (App-V) Management Console
segment.target: Application Virtualization (App-V) Management Console

segment.source: The App-V Management Console is a snap-in management utility for App-V Server administration.
segment.target: The App-V Management Console is a snap-in management utility for App-V Server administration.

segment.source: This component can be installed on the same computer as the App-V Server or on a separate workstation that has MMC 3.0 and .NET 2.0 installed.
segment.target: This component can be installed on the same computer as the App-V Server or on a separate workstation that has MMC 3.0 and .NET 2.0 installed.

segment.source: Application Virtualization (App-V) Sequencer
segment.target: Application Virtualization (App-V) Sequencer

segment.source: The App-V Sequencer monitors and captures the installation of applications and creates virtual application packages.
segment.target: The App-V Sequencer monitors and captures the installation of applications and creates virtual application packages.

segment.source: The output of the Sequencer consists of the application icon, the OSD file containing application definition information, a package manifest file, and an SFT file containing the application’s content files.
segment.target: The output of the Sequencer consists of the application icon, the OSD file containing application definition information, a package manifest file, and an SFT file containing the application’s content files.

segment.source: Optionally, a Windows Installer file can be created for installing the package without using the App-V infrastructure.
segment.target: Optionally, a Windows Installer file can be created for installing the package without using the App-V infrastructure.

segment.source: Application Virtualization (App-V) Client
segment.target: Application Virtualization (App-V) Client

segment.source: The App-V Client is installed on the App-V Desktop Client computer or on the App-V Terminal Services Client computer.
segment.target: The App-V Client is installed on the App-V Desktop Client computer or on the App-V Terminal Services Client computer.

segment.source: It provides the virtual environment for the virtual application packages.
segment.target: It provides the virtual environment for the virtual application packages.

segment.source: The App-V Client manages the package streaming to the cache, virtual application publishing refresh, and interaction with the Application Virtualization Servers.
segment.target: The App-V Client manages the package streaming to the cache, virtual application publishing refresh, and interaction with the Application Virtualization Servers.
